definitions.definition: (often with to) Able to be compared (to).
definitions.example: An elephant is comparable in size to a double-decker bus.

definitions.definition: Constituting a pair in a particular partial order.
definitions.example: Six and forty-two are comparable in the divides order, but six and nine are not.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Said of an adjective that has a comparative and superlative form.
definitions.example: "Big" is a comparable adjective, since it can take the forms "bigger" and "biggest"; but "unique" is not comparable, except in disputed, but common, usage.
